Again shows why he's not a scumbag or a idiot. 
 
 
WASHINGTON - Sen. John McCain (news, bio, voting record) (R-Ariz.), breaking from his party's Senate leadership, said Sunday that he would oppose any move to prohibit filibusters against judicial nominations...
 
 In that way, he argued, the precedent could ultimately hurt the GOP by allowing Democrats to bar the filibuster the next time they hold the White House and a majority in the Senate.

 It might be said that the filibuster, at least indirectly, thwarts the "will of the people".

I have heard a few thing about John McCain and from what I have heard he is one of the few true Conservatives left in the Republican Party that has been taken over by the Neo-cons and the Religious Right. BTW this is my own opinion and is taken from an outside perspective of US politics.
 
 It seems like McCain is not like your usual politician, he is thinking of the Long term consequences of the removal of the filibuster and he is also thinking outside of party political concerns. I can respect him for this.

McCaine is right. The Democrats are using the exact tactics that Republicans have used on them in the past, but now with the shoe on the other foot, the Republicans want to change the rules. Only a relatively small number of potential judges are in question with over 200 approved (I don't recall the exact numbers) and less than 30 in question. As far as the will of the people being thwarted, the people have no clue about the nominees or the process and will not unless a nominee is caught in bed with a dead girl or a live boy.
